greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the smallest number m >= n such that m^2 + n is a prime.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: Table[m = n; While[! PrimeQ[m^2 + n], m++]; m, {n, 100}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Aug 12 2012 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 10 2012
